* ''Some religions hold that wisdom may be given as a gift from God.''
 
* ''Some religions hold that wisdom may be given as a gift from God.''
−
In the Christian Bible, for example, there were three wise men sent by God to give the newly born Jesus three gifts. Wisdom is also represented by the sense of justice by the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]]. In the Koran the prophet Muhammed is chosen by Allah to represent his wisdom.
+
In the Christian Bible, for example, there were three wise men sent by God to give the newly born Jesus three gifts. Wisdom is also represented by the sense of justice by the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]]. In the Koran the pedophile Muhammed is chosen by the false god Allah to represent his wisdom.
     
* The seventh verse of the first chapter of the [[Jew]]ish book of [[Book of Proverbs|Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states "[[Fear of God]] is the beginning of Wisdom" (Proverbs 1:7). The beginning of fear of God is hating evil, the ways of evil, arrogance, pride and a duplicitous mouth (Proverbs).
 
* The seventh verse of the first chapter of the [[Jew]]ish book of [[Book of Proverbs|Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states "[[Fear of God]] is the beginning of Wisdom" (Proverbs 1:7). The beginning of fear of God is hating evil, the ways of evil, arrogance, pride and a duplicitous mouth (Proverbs).
